symbols.name: sap.ui.fl
symbols.description: SAPUI5 Library for SAPUI5 Flexibility and Descriptor Changes, App Variants, Control Variants (Views) and Personalization.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply
symbols.description: The sap.ui.fl.apply namespace should contain all code necessary to start a UI5 app for an end user with changes. Be aware that only the api sub-namespace contains public and stable APIs.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.app.AddAnnotationsToOData
symbols.description: Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_app_addAnnotationsToOData. Adds new annotations to an existing OData data source in the manifest.json under path sap.app.dataSources. Available only for build {@link sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.RegistrationBuild}.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.app.ChangeDataSouce
symbols.description: Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_app_changeDataSource. Changes a property of a specific sap.app/dataSource node in the manifest. Only supports operation == "UPDATE" and operation == "UPSERT". Only available during build time see {@link sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.RegistrationBuild}.

methods.name: applyChange

returnValue.description: Updated manifest with changed sap.app/dataSource

methods.description: Method to apply the appdescr_app_changeDataSource change to the manifest.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.app.SetTitle
symbols.description: Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_app_setTitle. Sets the title of the app by changing the manifest value sap.app/title. Available for both runtime and build {@link sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.Registration}.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.fiori.SetRegistrationIds
symbols.description: Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_fiori_setRegistrationIds. Sets and overwrites new array for sap.fiori/registrationIds. Creates new sap.fiori node if necesssary. Only available during build time {@link sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.RegistrationBuild}.

methods.name: applyChange

returnValue.description: Updated manifest with changed registrationIds

methods.description: Method to apply the appdescr_app_setRegistrationIds change to the manifest.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ovp.AddNewCard
symbols.description: Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_ovp_addNewCard. Adds a new card by changing the manifest value sap.ovp/cards. Available for both runtime and build {@link sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.Registration}.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ovp.ChangeCard
symbols.description: Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_app_changeCard. Sets key user card changes by changing the manifest value sap.ovp/cards. Available for both runtime and build {@link sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.Registration}.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ovp.DeleteCard
symbols.description: Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_ovp_removeCard. Deletes the card by changing the manifest value sap.ovp/cards. Available for both runtime and build {@link sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.Registration}.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.Preprocessor
symbols.description: Flex hook for preprocessing manifest early. Merges descriptor changes if needed.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.Registration
symbols.description: Loads and registers all descriptor change mergers for client-side merging.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.RegistrationBuild
symbols.description: Loads and registers all change handlers used during the build. Includes all change handlers used during runtime.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ui5.AddComponentUsages
symbols.description: Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_ui5_addComponentUsages. Adds component usages under sap.ui5/componentUsages node and creates parent node if not yet existing. Throws exception if to be added component usage already exists. Only available during build time {@link sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.RegistrationBuild}.

methods.name: applyChange

returnValue.description: Updated manifest with sap.ui5/componentUsages entity

methods.description: Method to apply the appdescr_ui5_addComponentUsages change to the manifest.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ui5.AddLibrary
symbols.description: Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_ui5_addLibraries. Loops over one change which might contain several libraries. If one library already exists, merge it, else add new library to manifest. Available for both runtime and build {@link sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.Registration}.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ui5.AddNewModel
symbols.description: Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_ui5_addNewModel. Adds a new model to the manifest.json under path sap.ui5.models. It can also make changes to the path sap.app.dataSources. It supports different types of models (for example: ResourceModel and OData). Available only for build {@link sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.RegistrationBuild}.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ui5.AddNewModelEnhanceWith
symbols.description: Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith. Adds a settings/enhanceWith node of an existing model with a path to an i18n properties file relative to the location of the manifest. Only works for referenced models of type sap.ui.model.resource.ResourceModel. Only available during build time {@link sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.RegistrationBuild}.

methods.name: applyChange

returnValue.description: Updated manifest with sap.ui5/models entity

methods.description: Method to apply the appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith change to the manifest.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ui5.SetFlexExtensionPointEnabled
symbols.description: Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_ui5_setFlexExtensionPointEnabled. Sets and overwrites boolean flag for sap.ui5/flexExtensionPointEnabled. Only available during build time {@link sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.RegistrationBuild}.

methods.name: applyChange

returnValue.description: Updated manifest with changed appdescr_ui5_setFlexExtensionPointEnabled

methods.description: Method to apply the appdescr_ui5_setFlexExtensionPointEnabled change to the manifest.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ui5.SetMinUI5Version
symbols.description: Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_ui5_setMinUI5Version. Sets minUI5Version to manifest node sap.ui5/dependencies/minUI5Version. Only updates minUI5Version if the new version is higher than the old version. Only available during build time {@link sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.RegistrationBuild}.

methods.name: applyChange

returnValue.description: Updated manifest with updated minUI5Version

methods.description: Method to apply the appdescr_ui5_setMinUI5Version change to the manifest.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.flexState.FlexState
symbols.description:
Flex state class to persist maps and raw state (cache) for a given component reference. The persistence happens inside an object mapped to the component reference, with the following properties:

{ appDescriptorMap: {}, changesMap: {}, variantsMap: {}, compVariantsMap: {}, storageResponse: { changes: { changes: [...], comp: { variants: [...], changes: [...], defaultVariants: [...], standardVariants: [...] } variants: [...], variantChanges: [...], variantDependentControlChanges: [...], variantManagementChanges: [...], ui2personalization: {...} }, loadModules: <boolean> }, partialFlexState: <boolean>, componentId: "<componentId>" }

callback.description: Callback that will be called after a variant has been applied

callAfterInitialVariant.description: The callback will also be called after the initial variant is applied

methods.description: Saves a function that will be called after a variant has been applied with the new variant as parameter. Even if the same variant is selected again the callback is called. The function also performs a sanity check after the control has been rendered. If the passed variant control ID does not match the responsible variant management control, the callback will not be saved. Optionally this function is also called after the initial variant is applied without a sanity check.

methods.name: clearVariantParameterInURL

control.name: control
control.description: Variant management control for which the URL technical parameter has to be cleared

methods.description: Clears URL technical parameter sap-ui-fl-control-variant-id for control variants. Use this method in case you normally want the variant parameter in the URL, but have a few special navigation patterns where you want to clear it. If you don't want that parameter in general, set the updateVariantInURL parameter on your variant management control to false. SAP Fiori elements use this method. If a variant management control is given as a parameter, only parameters specific to that control are cleared.

methods.name: detachVariantApplied

vmControlId.name: vmControlId
vmControlId.description: ID of the variant management control

methods.description: Removes the saved callback for the given control and variant management control.

methods.description: Retrieves the default variant for the current control synchronously. WARNING: The consumer has to make sure that the changes have already been retrieved with getChanges. It's recommended to use the async API getDefaultVariantId, which works regardless of any preconditions.

WARNING: The consumer has to make sure that the changes have already been retrieved with getChanges. It's recommended to use the async API getExecuteOnSelection, which works regardless of any preconditions.

returnValue.description: true if the variant downport scenario is enabled

methods.description: Indicates whether the variant downport scenario is enabled or not. This scenario is only enabled if the current layer is the VENDOR layer and the URL parameter hotfix is set to true.

methods.description: Indicates if the VENDOR layer is selected.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.interfaces.Delegate
symbols.description:
Interface for SAPUI5 flexibility delegates. Such delegates can be attached to controls to let key users add additional properties from metadata.

Example:

<mvc:View xmlns:mvc="sap.ui.core.mvc" xmlns:f="sap.ui.layout.form" xmlns:fl="sap.ui.fl" >
    <f:Form id="idForm"
        fl:delegate='{
            "name":"some/library/DelegateName",
            "payload":{
                "modelName":"Books"
            }
        }'
    >...</f:Form>
    ...
</mvc:View>

properties.name: control

properties.name: valueHelp
properties.description: Control representation for the value help, returned if it needs to be added separately

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.interfaces.delegate.PropertyInfo
symbols.description: Object containing metadata properties and nodes. Deep structure.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Technical name of the property, in case of nested properties (e.g. complex types in OData) it is the name of the property that has nested properties

properties.name: label
properties.description: If metadata has label information, it should be provided. A fallback to the technical name is implemented in the tooling and doesn't need to be provided by delegates

properties.name: tooltip
properties.description: If metadata has tooltip information (e.g. quickinfo annotation in OData), it should be provided. A fallback to the label or technical name is implemented in the tooling and doesn't need to be provided by delegates

properties.name: bindingPath
properties.description: Relative binding path, starting from the current binding context. Usually the same as the name, but for nested properties (e.g. complex properties or navigation properties) it has segments

properties.name: unsupported
properties.description: The delegate has to return all properties that could be bound somewhere. However some properties maybe shouldn't appear in the dialog (e.g. properties you would name in the filter attribute of SmartForms or properties that are unsupported by the delegate's create methods). These properties should be marked as unsupported.

properties.name: hideFromReveal
properties.description: The delegate has to return all properties that could be bound somewhere. However some properties maybe shouldn't appear in the dialog (e.g. based on UI.Hidden annotation or Field Control). These properties should be marked as hiddenByAnnotation.

properties.name: entityType
properties.description: Only needed for OData-based delegates to help custom field support tooling

properties.name: properties
properties.description: Some properties can be nested (e.g. based on complex types and navigation properties in OData). In this case the delegate can provide these nested properties. However currently only nesting of one level is supported by adaptation dialogs.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.interfaces.delegate.RepresentedPropertyInfo
symbols.description: Object containing information about properties represented on the UI. The property may be hidden, but was placed by someone before, so you would like to reveal it instead of recreating it.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Control ID that represents this metadata property

properties.name: bindingPaths
properties.description: Binding path that represents this property, the binding path doesn't need to be used in a real binding.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement
symbols.description:
Can be used to manage variants. You can use this control in most controls that are enabled for key user adaptation.
Note: On the user interface, variants are generally referred to as "views".

properties.name: showSetAsDefault
properties.description: Indicates that Set as Default is visible in the Save View and the Manage Views dialogs.

properties.name: manualVariantKey
properties.description:
If set to true, the key for a vendor variant will be added manually.
Note:This flag is only used internally in the app variant scenarios.

properties.name: inErrorState
properties.description: Indicates that the control is in error state. If set to true, an error message will be displayed whenever the variant is opened.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Indicates that the control is in edit state. If set to false, the footer of the Views list will be hidden.

properties.name: modelName
properties.description:
Determines the name of the model. The binding context will be defined by the current ID.

Note: In a UI adaptation scenario, this property is not used at all, because the model name is $FlexVariants.

properties.name: updateVariantInURL
properties.description:
Determines the intention of setting the current variant based on passed information.

Note: The VariantManagement control does not react in any way to this property.

properties.name: resetOnContextChange
properties.description: When set to false, doesn't reset the VariantManagement control to the default variant, when its binding context is changed.

properties.name: executeOnSelectionForStandardDefault
properties.description: Determines the behavior for Apply Automatically if the standard variant is marked as the default variant.

properties.name: displayTextForExecuteOnSelectionForStandardVariant
properties.description:
Defines the Apply Automatically text for the standard variant in the Manage Views dialog if the application controls this behavior.
Note: the usage of this property is restricted to sap.fe components only.

associations.name: for
associations.description: Contains the controls for which the variant management is responsible.

events.name: save
events.description: This event is fired when the Save View dialog or the Save As dialog is closed with the save button.

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.description: Indicates if an existing variant is overwritten or if a new variant is created.

events.name: cancel
events.description: This event is fired when users presses the cancel button inside Save As dialog.

events.name: manage
events.description: This event is fired when users apply changes to variants in the Manage Views dialog.

events.name: initialized

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.write.api.ChangesWriteAPI
symbols.description: Provides an API for tools like {@link sap.ui.rta} to create, apply and revert {@link sap.ui.fl.Change}.

methods.name: apply

returnValue.description: Promise that is resolved after all changes were applied in asynchronous case, or FakePromise for the synchronous processing scenario

change.name: change
change.description: Change object that should be applied to the passed control

element.name: element
element.description: Element instance to which the change should be applied

modifier.name: modifier
modifier.description: Modifier used to apply the change; if not provided, {@link sap.ui.core.util.reflection.JsControlTreeModifier} is used

appDescriptor.name: appDescriptor
appDescriptor.description: App descriptor containing the metadata of the current application

methods.description: Applies a specific change on the passed control if it is not already applied.

methods.name: create

returnValue.description: In case of a descriptor change, promise resolves to the created change. In case of a flex change, the created change object is returned.

changeSpecificData.name: changeSpecificData
changeSpecificData.description: Property bag holding the change information, see {@link sap.ui.fl.Change#createInitialFileContent} The property mPropertyBag.changeSpecificData.packageName is set to $TMP and internally since flex changes are always local when they are created.

methods.description: Creates a change on the flex persistence.

methods.name: revert

returnValue.description: Promise or fake promise resolving to the control on which change was reverted successfully or false when unsuccessful

change.name: change
change.description: Change object that should be reverted from the passed element

element.name: element
element.description: Element instance on which the change should be reverted

methods.description: Reverting a specific change on the passed control if it has already been applied or is in the process of being applied.
